docs.lead_paragraph: Plan ahead: These pink burgers are even better a day after they’re cooked.

headline.main: Beet, Rice and Goat Cheese Burgers

docs.lead_paragraph: Though commercial veggie burgers can fail to satisfy, the homemade variety offers endless possibilities of flavors and textures.

headline.seo: Quinoa and Greens Burger — Recipes for Health

docs.snippet: Though commercial veggie burgers can fail to satisfy, the homemade variety offers endless possibilities of flavors and textures.

docs.lead_paragraph: Women who have a vaginal delivery after a Caesarean are at increased risk of bleeding; there is also a small risk of fetal or infant death compared with a second C-section.

headline.seo: Slight Risk in Vaginal Birth After C-Section
headline.main: Childbirth: Slight Risk in Vaginal Birth After C-Section
headline.print_headline: Childbirth: Slight Risk in Vaginal Birth After C-Section

docs.abstract: Dr Caroline A Crowther study published online in journal PLoS Medicine finds that women who choose to have a vaginal birth after a previous Caesarean section may be at a slightly increased risk of complications.
docs.snippet: Women who have a vaginal delivery after a Caesarean are at increased risk of bleeding; there is also a small risk of fetal or infant death compared with a second C-section.

docs.lead_paragraph: For most transplant patients, a kidney received from a donor as old as 64 is just as likely to be successful as one from a younger person, an analysis has found.

headline.seo: Older Kidneys Work Just as Well for Most Transplant Patients
headline.main: Risks: Older Kidneys Work Fine for Transplants
headline.print_headline: Risks: Older Kidneys Work Fine for Transplants

docs.abstract: Dr John S Gill analysis in the Clinical Journal of the American Society of Nephrology finds that for most transplant patients, a kidney received from a donor as old as 64 is just as likely to be successful as one from a younger person.
docs.snippet: For most transplant patients, a kidney received from a donor as old as 64 is just as likely to be successful as one from a younger person, an analysis has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: A small randomized trial has found that acute mountain sickness can effectively be prevented with ibuprofen.

headline.seo: Ibuprofen Can Head Off Acute Mountain Sickness, Study Finds
headline.main: Prevention: Easy Way to Head Off Altitude Sickness
headline.print_headline: Prevention: Easy Way to Head Off Altitude Sickness

docs.abstract: Dr Grant S Lipman study published online in journal Annals of Emergency Medicine finds that acute mountain sickness--the headache, fatigue, dizziness, nausea and vomiting that can occur at altitudes above 8,000 feet--can effectively be prevented with ibuprofen.
docs.snippet: A small randomized trial has found that acute mountain sickness can effectively be prevented with ibuprofen.

docs.lead_paragraph: An experimental drug that works in a novel way to lower cholesterol proved even more effective than statins and had few side effects, according to newly released data.

headline.seo: Drug to Cut Cholesterol Level Tests Better Than Statins
headline.main: Drug to Cut Cholesterol Tests Better Than Statin
headline.print_headline: Drug to Cut Cholesterol Tests Better Than Statin

docs.abstract: Studies by Dr Evan A Stein in The New England Journal of Medicine find that REGN727, an experimental drug that works in a novel way to lower cholesterol, is more effective than statins and has few undesirable side effects.
docs.snippet: An experimental drug that works in a novel way to lower cholesterol proved even more effective than statins and had few side effects, according to newly released data.

docs.lead_paragraph: In “The Undead,” the science journalist Dick Teresi casts transplant surgeons and neurologists as villains in the dim purgatories where life and death can be difficult to distinguish.

headline.seo: ‘The Undead’ Book Review - Seeing Bogeymen in the Fog Around Brain Death
headline.main: Seeing Bogeymen in the Fog Around Brain Death
headline.print_headline: Seeing Bogeymen in the Fog Around Brain Death

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews book The Undead: Organ Harvesting, the Ice-Water Test, Beating Heart Cadavers -- How Medicine Is Blurring the Line Between Life and Death by Dick Teresi.
docs.snippet: In “The Undead,” the science journalist Dick Teresi casts transplant surgeons and neurologists as villains in the dim purgatories where life and death can be difficult to distinguish.

docs.lead_paragraph: An experiment in giving out the condoms cost about $18,000 per H.I.V. infection prevented, but caring for AIDS patients is even more expensive.

headline.seo: Female Condom Giveaway Is Expensive, but Cost-Effective
headline.main: Female Condom Giveaway Is Expensive, but Still Cost-Effective, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Washington: Female Condom Giveaway Is Expensive, But Still Cost-Effective, Report Says

docs.abstract: Study by scientists at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health finds that giving away free female condoms is a highly productive use of public health investment, especially in light of the high medical cost of caring for AIDS patients.
docs.snippet: An experiment in giving out the condoms cost about $18,000 per H.I.V. infection prevented, but caring for AIDS patients is even more expensive.

docs.lead_paragraph: Learning to drive is hard and scary for many teenagers, but the challenges are significantly greater for adolescents who have attention problems.

headline.seo: A.D.H.D. Challenges Those Seeking a Driver’s License
headline.print_headline: Roadblocks to a Rite of Passage

docs.abstract: Learning to drive, a rite of passage for American teenagers, can be significantly more difficult for adolescents with attention problems; largest group of challenged teenagers, and those most closely studied, appears to be those with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; researchers say that many teenagers with ADHD or other learning problems can become good drivers, but not easily or quickly, and may be better off waiting until they are older.
docs.snippet: Learning to drive is hard and scary for many teenagers, but the challenges are significantly greater for adolescents who have attention problems.
